column1: Google Home Page Test Plan - Version 1

column2: Pass
Step
Given User is viewing the Google home page (https://www.google.com)
Then the following is true
Text: Google
Current favicon as specified in release documentation

Links formatting is:
  Font Family: "Arial, Sans-Serif"
  Font Size: 13px
  Color: Black
Links: "About", "Store"
Links: "Gmail", "Images"; Grid Menu; Alerts Menu
Rightmost Button: "Sign In"

Rightmost Button: Circle with initial of first name of User in the center,
opens user menu
Image: Google logo, styled as specified in the daily art documentation

Text Box: Search box with search by voice microphone button on the
right side
Button Left: "Google Search"
Button Right: "I'm Feeling Lucky"

Background Color: #F2F2F2
Links:
  Font Family: "Arial, Sans-Serif"
  Font Size: 13px
  Color: #5F6368
Links: "Advertising", "Business"
Links: "Privacy", "Terms", "Settings"
Given User is at the Google home page (https://www.google.com)
When User clicks inside the search box
Then the recent searches menu appears
Given User is at the Google home page (https://www.google.com)
And User clicks inside the search box
When User enters text
And User performs a search (clicks "Google Search" button or inputs the "Enter" key)
Then search is executed and User is on the search results page
(Continued from above) When User clicks the browser's back button
Then User is returned to the Google home page with an empty search box
When User does not enter any text
And User performs a search
Then search is not executed and User remains on the Google home page
When User includes a word in quotes
And User performs a search
Then search is executed and User is on the search results page and all results include the quoted word(s) in the title or meta description
When User includes a minus immediately before a word
And User performs a search
Then search is executed, User is on the search results page and all results exclude the negated word(s) in the title or meta description
When User inputs a long word (> 128 characters)
And User performs a search
Then search is executed, User is on the no search results page, with the message: [word inputted]... is too long a word. Try using a shorter word
When User inputs text that returns no results
And User performs a search
Then search is executed, User is on the no search results page, with the message: Your search - [search terms] - did not match any documents. Suggestions: Try different keywords.
When User enters only stop/lexical words
column6: and, or, the, is, at, want, that, which, there, a, an, not

column2: And User performs a search

Then search is executed, User is on the search results page, and the stop words are considered if they appear to be the main subject of results. For example, searching for: and or not returns results about logical operators and logic gates
When User enters leading spaces
And User performs a search
Then leading spaces are stripped before search executes
When User enters trailing spaces
And User performs a search
Then trailing spaces are stripped before search executes
When User attempts JavaScript injection
And User performs a search
Then search is executed, User is on the search results page with results for the search input, and JavaScript injection fails
Given User is at the Google home page (https://www.google.com)
And User clicks inside the search box
When User enters text
Then the search suggestions menu appears with 10 search suggestions and buttons: "Google Search", "I'm Feeling Lucky"
When User enters many wide characters
Then there is no text overflow outside of the search box
When User enters emojis
Then the emojis are displayed as emojis, not unknown Unicode
Given User is at the Google home page (https://www.google.com)
And User enters text
When User clicks "I'm Feeling Lucky" button
Then User is on the page that Google returned as the first search result
Given User is at the Google home page (https://www.google.com)
When User clicks inside the search box
And User enters the text "a"
And User clicks a search suggestion
Then the search box is populated with the text of the suggestion and User is on the search results page

column1: Type in, then Exit Search Box

column2: Given User is at the Google home page (https://www.google.com)
When User clicks inside the search box
And User enters text
And User clicks outside of the search box
When User clicks inside the search box
Then the search suggestions menu does not reappear
Given User is at the Google home page (https://www.google.com)
When User clicks "About" link in the header
Then User is on the About Google page
Given User is at the Google home page (https://www.google.com)
When User clicks "Store" link in the header
Then User is on the Google Store page
Given User is at the Google home page (https://www.google.com)
When User clicks "Gmail" link in the header
Then User is on the Gmail login page, if not logged in, or on the Gmail home page, if logged in
Given User is at the Google home page (https://www.google.com)
When User clicks "Images" link in the header
Then User is on Google Images home page (http://www.google.com/imghp)
